listing.listing_description:
A renovated farmhouse nestled on a private estate, Villa Leonardo charms with cozy interiors and lush garden. The 12 acre grounds provide peace, quiet and spectacular views of the countryside near Montespertoli, in the heart of Chianti, but Florence is just 30 minutes away. Take a break from it all in beautifully restored surroundings, or use the villa as a base for exploring Tuscany.

Villa Leonardo is well suited to both play and work, if you must. Drive through the property’s remote-controlled gate and onto the gravel courtyard in front of the vine-covered house. At the back of the house, a long terrace has sunny areas for lounging and a covered area for al fresco dining. The fenced-in pool has its own patio, complete with chaise longues and umbrellas. If you can’t completely unplug, the villa does have a computer, printer, fax machine and Wi-Fi access.

Inside, the villa is charming and cozy. Beamed ceilings, painted wood trim, brick floors and a fireplace make the living room feel rustic and casual, while accents like wrought-iron furniture and a chandelier in the dining room add a touch of elegance. The spacious eat in kitchen pairs state-of-the-art appliances with a cheery tile backsplash and farmhouse-style shelving, and opens to the terrace.

Villa Leonardo’s six bedrooms are spread out over two floors. On the ground floor, one bedroom has two twin beds and a private adjacent bathroom, and the second bedroom has two twin beds, an en-suite bathroom and access to the garden. The other four bedrooms, all on the second floor, have optional air conditioning and en-suite bathrooms. There are two bedrooms with king beds, and two bedrooms with two twin beds each.

During your stay, take time to visit the nearby medieval village of Montespertoli, once owned by the Machiavelli family and now a hotspot for wine festivals. Horseback riding, tennis and golf are also close by, or if you’re looking for a more urban adventure, make the 30 km drive to Florence. Just a bit farther are San Gimignano, 34 km away; Siena, 65.9 km away; and Pisa, 72.4 km away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

ul.li: Bedroom 1: 2 Twin beds, Private adjacent bathroom with shower
Bedroom 2: 2 Twin beds, Ensuite bathroom with shower, Direct access to garden
Bedroom 3 - Master: King size bed, Ensuite bathroom with tub and shower, Air conditioning
Bedroom 4: King size bed, Ensuite bathroom with shower and skylight window, Air conditioning
Bedroom 5: 2 Twin beds, Ensuite bathroom with shower, Air conditioning
Bedroom 6: 2 Twin beds, Ensuite bathroom with tub and shower, Air conditioning
Air conditioned bedrooms – 1st floor rooms only

feature.p: At Extra Cost – advance notice may be required:
The house is accessed by a private, dirt road (half a mile).

feature.strong: What to do in the Chianti region of Tuscany?
feature.p: Don't miss a visit to the town of Montespertoli, in the center of the Chianti region. "A terrace overlooking the world" is the most accurate definition of this lovely town, which boasts views from high above Florence and convenient proximity to other large tourist areas of Tuscany. Montespertoli considers itself one of the capitals of Tuscan wine, and each year from the last Sunday in May to the first Sunday in June, holds a Chianti Wine Festival and a Stamp Exhibition about wine and vines. The first weekend after November 6th is the time for a local festival for "Vino Novello." The medieval town of Montespertoli had an important role due to its road network, which permitted Florence to carry out commerce in the direction of Volterra and Siena. Worth a visit is the castle which flanks Montespertoli (it belonged to the Machiavellis) and the "Museum of Sacred Art" located in the ample and beautiful presbytery of the Pieve of San Piero in Mercato. The precious paintings, silverworks and hangings are testimony of the historical and artistic importance of the area.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Gilda is a beautiful villa set in a peaceful and rural location near the baroque town of Noto, an idyllic base for exploring the rural south-east coast of Sicily.

A modern structure made of pale, local stone, the villa sits gracefully on a hillside overlooking olive groves which stretch to the coast.  The garden has been landscaped to enhance the surroundings, incorporating olive trees and traditional stone walls with palms, cactus and a smooth green lawn. Guests are encouraged to enjoy outside living to the full. You can help yourself to fruit and vegetables grown in the garden, cool off in the inviting pool, have a siesta on a sun lounger and dine together under a pergola.

The uncluttered interiors of Villa Gilda have a clean, modern finish throughout with carefully chosen furniture and furnishings in a neutral colour palette of contemporary grey, white and beige. The living space is on the ground floor with a modern kitchen and a comfortable living room which opens out to the terrace, furnished with an outside sofa and chairs. Downstairs there are three bedrooms, each with their own bathroom and french windows opening out to the garden.

Despite its rural location, Villa Gilda is just 10 minutes drive from the baroque town of Noto with its shops, restaurants and attractive historic centre.  Enjoyable day trips include visiting the fishing village of Marzamemi, exploring nearby sandy beaches and visiting the Vendicari nature reserve, known for its flamingos.

feature.strong: From June 23rd to September 1st arrivals and departures must be on a Saturday to Saturday basis. From March 1st to June 22th and then from September 2nd to December 31st, arrival and departure dates are flexible. Please inquire with one of our Villa Specialists for more details.

listing.listing_description:
Ensconce yourself in modern luxury in the heart of London at Royalty Mews Penthouse. Thanks to its Soho location, this contemporary vacation rental puts the city's shopping, dining, historic sites and cultural attractions at your doorstep. Reserve its three bedrooms for an urban getaway with friends, a sightseeing holiday with family or even an active honeymoon in the thick of it all.

Start each day with a coffee from the espresso machine, sipped at the al-fresco dining area on the villa's private terrace, or finish the evening with a glass of wine under the stars. A TV and sound system will help you unwind, Wi-Fi makes it easy to keep in touch, and both heating and air conditioning ensure your comfort no matter what the season-or the English weather.

Thoughtfully designed and beautifully appointed, the penthouse embodies the best of sleek, modern British style. A nearly wall-to-wall sliding door floods the living room with light, while sculptural furniture is both lovely to look at and comfortable to sit in. A breakfast bar is an inviting focal point in the fully equipped kitchen, and there's also a dining table for four.

Each of the three bedrooms at Royalty Mews Penthouse has a King bed; two of them have en-suite bathrooms and the third has shared access to a hall bathroom. Neutral tones give the bedrooms a serene ambience, and in the bathrooms, stone panels and on-trend brass-toned fixtures lend a spa-worthy appeal.

During your stay, sample the Soho shopping and dining just outside the villa or take advantage of the location to walk to Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden to sightsee. The property is a 20-minute drive or less from sights such as Westminster Abbey, the London Eye, St. Paul's Cathedral, Buckingham Palace and the tower that houses Big Ben, so it's easy to tick off everything on your must-see list.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

ul.li: Bedroom 1: King size bed, Ensuite bathroom with stand-alone rain shower
Bedroom 2: King size bed, Shared access to hall bathroom

listing.listing_description:
As ornate and colorful as its prime Positano setting, Villa Dorata is among our most opulent villas on the Amalfi Coast. With frescoed ceilings, a private wine cellar, and a full-service spa, this luxurious Baroque-style home has to be seen to be believed.

Surrounded by lemon and orange trees, Villa Dorata offers panoramic views of the sea and Positano, one of the Amalfi Coast’s most picturesque towns. The magnificent yet traditional exterior hides a wealth of amenities, including a private spa with a Turkish steam bath, tiled pool with waterfall and resistance swimming option, sauna, hot tub, massage room, and more.

Inside the palazzo, the formal living room features gilt-framed paintings and a grand fireplace. Built-in bookshelves add a sense of history to the dining room, decorated with a crystal chandelier and antiques, and red drapes frame the villa’s sea views. With a stone fireplace and two pizza ovens, the Italian kitchen is every chef’s dream; for a memorable experience, take advantage of the complimentary Italian cooking class offered with each stay.

On the first floor, the two lavish master bedrooms feature spacious sitting rooms, private en-suite bathrooms, and access to the sea view terrace. Upstairs, two junior queen suites offer views of the sea, gardens and Positano, with private access to the walled citrus garden. An additional spare bedroom with single bed and a private bathroom provides additional space for a teenage child or member of staff.

Known for its exceptional restaurants and pebbled beaches, the town center of Positano is just a 15-minute walk away. Daily continental breakfasts and cook service are included with your stay at Villa Dorata, offering a truly relaxing escape. After all, what could be more appealing after a day exploring the Amalfi Coast’s attractions, than a restoring spa session and dinner on the sea-view terrace?

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: Bedroom 1 – Master 1: King size bed, En-suite bathroom with stone shower, Air conditioning/Heating, Television, Surround sound system, Mini fridge, Sitting room, 2 Small balconies
Bedroom 2 – Master 2: Queen size bed, En-suite bathroom with large shower, Air conditioning/Heating, Television, Surround sound system, Mini fridge, Sitting room

feature.p: The high Baroque architectural details evident throughout the villa are highlighted by a rich jewel tone color scheme, gilt-framed works of art, and romantic terraces. There are sumptuously soft sofas, crystal chandeliers, lavish draperies, inlaid ceilings, and exquisite alcoves that make a stay at villa Dorata a life-long memory. Outside, Eden-like gardens and surrounding groves make lounging and dining al fresco as privileged an experience as life within. Couple all this with a full staff just waiting to attend to your needs, including freshly squeezed juices from the lemons and oranges grown outside your bedroom windows, homemade marmalades and pastries, the finest wine cellar, and two traditional Italian pizza fornos!
feature.strong: What to do along the Amalfi Coast:
feature.p: In addition to lovely beaches, Positano offers an abundance of cafes, shops, art galleries and restaurants. A scenic drive along the coastal road (SS145) takes visitors to Praiano, Amalfi and the spellbinding up-hill town of Ravello, with its incomparable belvedere. Other excursion possibilities include a boat trip to the islands, a visit to vibrant Napoli or Salerno, or an exploration of Pompeii and Herculaneum—the fascinating ruins of ancient cities destroyed by the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in the 1st century A.D.
Contact Luxury Retreats to arrange boat rentals and excursions.

listing_cancellation_info.cancellation: Cancel up to 95 days before your trip and get a full refund. Cancel within 95 days of the trip and the reservation is non-refundable.

listing.listing_description:
Find innovative design alongside classic Amalfi Coast scenery at Villa Galidia. This seaside vacation rental is filled with clever architecture and inspiring artwork. What’s more, its perch high above the water is only a few minutes’ walk from shopping, dining and more in the town of Sorrento. Reserve this four-bedroom luxury property for a laid-back holiday with friends or a trip spent exploring the area with family.

Your stay at Villa Galidia includes daily housekeeping and continental breakfast. When you’ve finished sipping your morning coffee at the al-fresco dining table, shift to a lounger in the sun or stretch out in the indoor exercise room. In the evenings, stay outside around the barbecue and hot tub, or relax inside with the help of the smart TV and Wi-Fi.

The villa’s bright, beautiful rooms are a thoughtful pairing of the traditional and modern. Refined sofas sit under high ceilings and geometric wallpaper in the living room, while a contemporary staircase floats above the table in the dining room. The inviting kitchen is fully equipped and has a breakfast area.

Villa Galidia has one bedroom with a king bed and a private en-suite bathroom. There is one other bedroom with a king bed, and two bedrooms with queen beds. These three bedrooms have shared access to a hall bathroom, but direct access to a terrace or balcony.

If you can tear yourself away from the villa’s spectacular views over the Mediterranean Sea, it’s less than a 10-minute walk to the town center of Sorrento, where you can browse local boutiques or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at a waterfront eatery. The villa is also a short drive from the town of Positano and its beach, as well as the must-see ruins of Pompeii.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Escape to classic French Riviera charm—with a contemporary twist—at La Calado. Pretty and traditional on the outside, chic and modern on the inside, this Antibes vacation rental is a wonderfully stylish retreat. At five bedrooms and a short distance from downtown, it’s the perfect size for reconnecting with family and the perfect spot for exploring the area with friends.

Private gardens filled with cypress and olive trees, lavender and rosemary bring a little piece of the French countryside to the villa’s quiet neighborhood just minutes from Antibes. Savor the scents and sunshine from terraces with a heated pool and lounging and dining areas. In the evenings, flip on the Apple TV, surround-sound system and Wi-Fi, or treat yourself to a session in the hammam or a glass from the wine cellar.

While the original villa is a Belle Epoque gem, this luxury property has been lovingly restored to a bright, modern finish. Parquet floors, pale wood accents and white walls link the living room and dining room, and doors lead into a fully equipped kitchen with a stunning waterfall marble breakfast bar.

Each of the five bedrooms at La Calado has a king bed and en-suite bathroom, as well as the same considered style as the main living areas. Details such as exposed ceiling beams and cozy window seats lend charm, while in the bathrooms, patterned tile has spa-worthy appeal.

Spend your holiday ensconced in the villa or sightseeing around the Riviera. It’s a short drive from the residence to shopping, dining and ancient fortifications in the old town area of Antibes, and to popular, sandy Salis Beach. Relive your honeymoon over a drink at the exclusive Hotel du Cap-Eden Rock or make the short drive to Cannes for a stroll along the famous Croisette.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Step into the beating heart of Barcelona at Penthouse Balmes. Set close to some of the city's top attractions, this convenient vacation rental makes it easy to immerse yourself in the life-and culture, cuisine and more-of this vibrant metropolis. Sleek, modern spaces and four bedrooms mean you can share the experience with up to eight friends or family members.

While this luxury penthouse is close to the beach, you can have your own day in the sun on the loungers on the villa's private terrace. Stretch out in the exercise room in the mornings and, after a day of sightseeing, turn on the TV or iPod docking station to unwind, or browse via Wi-Fi to keep up with emails.

Neutral tones, wood floors and plenty of windows give the penthouse's living spaces a bright, airy vibe. A pair of sofas and a dining table for eight mean there's room for everyone in the open-concept living and dining room. And a fully equipped kitchen with minimalist white cabinets means it's a snap to prepare fresh finds from the local market.

Penthouse Balmes has two bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms: one with a king bed and one with a queen bed. The other two bedrooms have a king bed and two twin beds, respectively, and share a hall bathroom.

In the Barcelona City neighborhood surrounding the villa, you'll find a range of restaurants and shops with everything you'll need while on holiday, as well as a fitness center with a pool, sauna, paddle tennis and more. The property is close to city sights like the Plaza de Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia and Gothic Quarter. But with the beach just a 15-minute drive away, you can also make a honeymoon-style escape to the sand on a whim.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The glamour of the French Riviera is alive and well at the newly built Villa Colibri. From sleek finishes to colorful mod furnishings, the ’70s-inspired chic of this luxury vacation rental will make you feel like a star on a warm-weather holiday. Thanks to its setting on a hillside just outside La Croix-Valmer, the ten-bedroom property even boasts views over vineyards and the countryside to the sea.

The villa’s quiet, private lot has been groomed with lush lawns, manicured gardens and whimsical sculptures. The main house is oriented to look out to the Mediterranean over a lawn dotted with lounge chairs and a heated infinity pool and hot tub. While away the day in the Riviera sunshine, then pour a glass of wine to sip in the shade of the al-fresco dining area as you heat up the barbecue for dinner. In the evenings, you can watch the stars come out from the second-floor terrace or enjoy a movie in the home theater.

An inspired mix of textures and colors gives the interiors of Villa Colibri their own vibrant personality. The great room is dominated by a double-sided stone fireplace and filled with bold pieces like a mint-green velour sofa, candy-colored accent pillows, gold-framed bookcases and matching dining chairs with ocean-blue cushions. The fully equipped kitchen takes a more minimalist but equally appealing tack, with smoked glass hiding the vent hood and flat-fronted cabinetry.

In addition to the main house, there are three separate apartments at Villa Colibri; all three apartments have fully equipped kitchens and all ten bedrooms have king beds. The main house has three bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms and two that share a bathroom, the first apartment’s two bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and the second apartment’s two bedrooms share a bathroom. The third apartment, which could be used as a honeymoon suite within the property, has a bedroom with an en-suite bathroom.

The closest town to Villa Colibri is La Croix-Valmer, whose shops and restaurants are just a 10-minute walk away. If you’re traveling with family, you may enjoy exploring quieter seaside towns such as Gigaro, Cavalaire-sur-Mer, Ramatuelle and Port Grimaud. Otherwise, head straight for the glitz of Saint-Tropez, 12 km away. There are six beaches within an 13 km drive of the villa, as well as a golf course just under 14 km away. At the end of your stay, plan on a 16 km drive to La Môle - Saint Tropez Airport or a 108 km drive to Nice Côte d’Azur Airport.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Seek out simple luxury in Tuscany at Villa Ferranesi. This reconstructed farm was modeled on traditional houses in the Crete Senesi region, and sits amid quintessential rolling hills in the Asciano area outside Siena. Nine beautifully appointed bedrooms mean you can bring up to eighteen friends or family members on your Italian escape.

Lay out under the Tuscan sun in loungers around the swimming pool, try out local specialties in the outdoor pizza oven and serve up refreshments at the al-fresco dining table. In the evenings, lay a fire in the wood-burning fireplace, watch TV or share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi.

While Villa Ferranesi looks to be all traditional stone walls from the outside, the interiors are open and bright, with soaring wood-beamed ceilings and graceful archways. A comfortable living room and inviting dining room are separated by the entryway and lit by high-set windows. The eat-in kitchen is fully equipped and even has a Nespresso machine.

This expansive vacation rental has four bedrooms in its main house, two bedrooms in a guest house and three honeymoon-style private one-bedroom suites. All nine bedrooms have king beds and en-suite bathrooms, and many of the suites have their own living and dining areas as well. For larger parties, a double sofa bed is available in the two-bedroom house.

From the villa’s location outside the town of Asciano, it’s easiest to explore the surrounding hills by car. Several nearby towns have, among other attractions, a historic abbey and sculpture garden, and the hill town of Montalcino is within easy reach. Visit the awe-inspiring pope’s palace in the UNESCO-designated town of Pienza, or taste the local wine in Montepulciano. For a memorable day trip, drive to the nearest city, Siena.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Vacation in high aristocratic style at the five-bedroom Villa Spada. Built in the 1700s as a hunting lodge for the Spada family, this restored home near Lucca offers historic elegance with modern comforts. Families or groups of up to ten will appreciate the manicured gardens, antique furnishings and panoramic views of the Tuscan hills.

Pass by the villa’s stone lions to enter the lush grounds and terraced gardens, including a walled formal garden. Stroll beneath cypress and lemon trees and hibiscus, or catch up on reading in the shade of a centuries-old lime tree. Take in the view with your morning espresso or evening aperitif from the dining area on the terrace, or lounge by the pool. A baby kit is available for the youngest travelers; for adults, there’s Wi-Fi access.

The heart of Villa Spada is a gracious living room that opens to the terrace through French doors. Throughout the house, you’ll find antique furnishings and paintings and original moldings. In the large, airy living rooms, the more ornate details are balanced by comfortable modern sofas and neutral tones. The eat-in kitchen has a food processor and dishwasher, plus traditional stone work surfaces and a corner fireplace.

The villa’s bedrooms have an equally lovely mix of old and new, pairing antique wooden beds and desks with jaunty striped rugs and walls. There are three bedrooms with king beds, two of which have en-suite bathrooms and one of which has a bathroom with tub. The fourth bedroom has a twin bed and bathroom with tub, and the fifth bedroom has two single beds and a shared bathroom.

Villa Spada’s location makes it easy to explore the region. If you’ve forgotten anything, the grocery store in Valpromaro is just 5 minutes away. Pack your racquets for a trip to the tennis court in San Concordio di Mariano, 5 km away, or your clubs for a round at the Forte dei Marmi golf course, about 30 km away. A 18 km drive will take you the center of Lucca, and a 53 km drive brings you to the Pisa airport or beach at Viareggio.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Pettolecchia La Residenza is your private masseria located in Fasano, the heart of Puglia on the “heel” of Italy. Dating from the fifteenth century, the property is a lasting example of the many masserie, or farms, that once dotted the region. Set on eight hectares of pastoral land and featuring accommodations for ten and an attentive staff, this vacation rental is an idyllic setting for a family reunion, intimate destination wedding or simply a relaxed holiday exploring the nearby towns, countryside and coast.

The grounds at this historic luxury villa include an impressive L-shaped swimming pool, parasols and plenty of padded sun loungers. Serve refreshments from the outdoor bar, or try out local specialties in the comfort of one of the al-fresco dining areas. Inside, you’ll find an espresso machine for good mornings and a wine fridge and roulette table for even better evenings, as well as a television and Wi-Fi. For your comfort and convenience, your stay at the masseria includes the services of a butler, housekeeper and nighttime security guard.

The strong lines of the villa’s stone walls and arched doorways set the tone for its palatial interiors, filled with one-of-a-kind antiques and paintings in the elegant traditional style. To set off classic pieces like the portraits and landscapes in gilded frames, however, the villa also has more modern furnishings, from a playful cherry-red sofa and armchairs to clean-lined dining chairs. The fully equipped minimalist kitchen is beautifully integrated into the original building, with super sleek cabinetry built into the textured stone walls.

Five bedrooms, each with a double bed and en-suite bathroom, can accommodate up to eleven guests. Along with the villa’s staff, air conditioning in the bedrooms ensures your comfort on the warmest summer nights, and large windows and doors opening to a terrace and the surrounding olive groves let in both fresh air and plenty of Italian sunshine.

Whether you’re visiting with family or for a romantic occasion such as a honeymoon or anniversary, Puglia has plenty to offer, from ancient Roman roads to a thriving local cuisine. The villa itself is just a short drive (or a ride on the property’s bikes) from the Coccaro Beach Club and the San Domenico Golf Course. The nearby town of Savelletri is the perfect spot to try fresh-caught seafood at an oceanfront café, and you’ll find more dining and shopping in the enchanting streets of Fasano and incredibly photogenic whitewashed buildings in Ostuni.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Spend days exploring the perfume capital of the world and nights mingling with the jet set along the French Riviera at Villa La Corniche. Named for the French word for cliff, this luxury vacation rental is perched above the city of Grasse, which has been producing fragrances for centuries. Book the property for a quiet getaway with friends and family, or as a private retreat from the film festival in downtown Cannes, just 15 minutes away.

Take in sweeping views from the Southern Alps in the east to the Esterel Mountains in the west from the villa’s beautifully appointed terrace. More than an acre of gardens includes a heated pool, a sunny terrace with loungers and an al-fresco shower. Entertaining in the Riviera sunshine is a snap thanks to a pool house with a wine cellar, a barbecue, and outdoor dining tables for up to twenty-four guests. On cooler nights, step inside to gather around the satellite and Apple TVs; in the winter months, a gas fireplace will quickly dispel any chills.

Recently renovated and thoughtfully designed, the open-concept interiors of Villa La Corniche are bright and modern. The inviting great room, encompassing sun-kissed sitting and dining areas and a fully equipped kitchen, welcomes guests with a mix of traditional and exotic pieces, from a tufted leather sofa to geometric poufs. Cozy up to the fireplace in the sitting area, or open the space to the terrace with several sets of French doors.

The villa’s three bedrooms, all with en-suite bathrooms and shared balconies, can host parties of up to six on holiday together. There are two with king beds, including a master suite that boasts a fireplace and gorgeous views, and one with a queen bed.

Though Villa La Corniche feels tranquil and relaxed, it’s less than a mile from downtown Grasse, where visitors can tour historic perfumeries such as Galimard, Fragonard and Molinard. Visit during the month of August to experience the Fête du Jasmin, or Jasmine Festival, when crowds gather in the street to watch a parade, performances and fireworks. Or spend a laid-back day driving the coastal roads between Cannes, Antibes and Nice—all within day-trip distance—finishing with a honeymoon-style dinner at an oceanfront restaurant.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Experience contemporary luxury in the setting of a charming, traditional beach town at Villa Alegria. Set on a cliff over the village of Salema, this breathtaking vacation rental boasts views over one of the prettiest landscapes in the Algarve and a location just steps from the beach. Share a sun-splashed holiday with up to eight friends and family at this four-bedroom haven—or a honeymoon-style escape with your beloved.

Terraced gardens set into the hillside offer sea views at every level. At the rooftop, you’ll find an expansive outdoor living area with a pool, lounging and dining areas, and a barbecue. Inside the villa, high-tech amenities range from a satellite TV and DVD player to Wi-Fi.

Nearly wall-to-wall windows on two sides bring the sea views into the open-plan living and dining room. Sleek furnishings add modern flair, while a color scheme of rich blues and crisp whites is a nod to the oceanfront location. The fully equipped kitchen is tucked behind the great room, but keeps the color scheme going with glossy white cabinetry and a cerulean backsplash.

Each of the four bedrooms at Villa Alegria has a king bed and en-suite bathroom; one bedroom also has its own fireplace, and two of the bedrooms share a terrace. In each suite, you’ll find the same modern lines, cool tones and thoughtful details such as built-in storage.

While the villa is a private seaside retreat, it’s only a 1-minute walk from the Salema beach, a stretch of golden sand frequented by visitors and locals alike. Pause to watch the fishermen unload the day’s catch, or while away an afternoon at restaurant on the water. For golf, tennis and a spa, drive to Santo Antonio Resort; for more shopping and dining options, drive into Lagos.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Camparone is a majestic Tuscan villa in the countryside east of Siena. Nestled amid vineyards and olive groves on a vast estate, the villa consists of two antique buildings (a farmhouse and barn) dating from the fifteenth century. This authentic caselo's vintage character has been beautifully maintained in the stone facades, chestnut wood beams, terracotta tile, gorgeous brickwork, and enchanting gardens, while contemporary features include air conditioning, Wi-Fi, and high-end amenities for cooking and entertainment. Six bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms accommodate twelve guests in total comfort.

The villa's expansive property forms an archetypal Tuscan scene, with centuries-old cypresses, wisteria-clad pergolas, and colorful flowers scenting the air. Ample lawns provide a lovely venue for special occasions or playful fun, while multiple terraces and verandas inspire alfresco delights. Refresh yourself in the swimming pool and bask in the Mediterranean sunlight on lovely lounge chairs. Kindle the barbeque in the afternoon and relish a meal in the shade of grapevines. Sip a local Chianti wine in the loggia while admiring the panoramic views.

The main interior living area evokes the cozy elegance of a country cottage, with white wall and ceiling finishes lending a fresh feel to the classic ambiance. Open the glass doors to the patio in the summer months, and light a fire in the stone hearth on cool evenings. Sip aperitivi in the living room, or relax with a favorite book in the library. Prepare meals in the wonderful kitchen (featuring a pizza oven, chef-grade appliances, and enchanting rustic décor), and gather around the dining table for festive nighttime feasts.

There are four bedrooms in the main house and two in the guest house. All enjoy ensuite bathrooms and air conditioning, and several of the rooms include private sitting areas. The guest house bedrooms share a small living area with kitchenette, as well as an outdoor veranda.

This prime location is surrounded by charming villages, wineries, and architectural treasures, and is just a short drive from the Renaissance splendors of Siena. Florence, Arezzo, and the coastal Grosseto region offer lovely daytrip options. The villa is an excellent choice for destination wedding guests.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
From its hilltop location, La Veduta di Vertine enjoys sweeping views of the Chianti Classico region’s olive groves, rolling hills, and dynamic sunsets. You and your guests are sure to appreciate the villa’s sixteenth-century architecture, rustic-chic decor, and carefully integrated touches of modern luxury. With five beautiful bedrooms and plenty of outdoor space, this villa can accommodate up to fourteen guests, making it perfect for a special occasion like a destination wedding, family reunion, or high-end corporate retreat.

Tradition meets elegance at La Veduta di Vertine. Stately furniture, ornate floor coverings, and intricate stonework reside under vaulted exposed-beam ceilings, promoting a warm and welcoming, yet formal environment. Chandelier lighting and grand fireplaces set an intimate tone at night, while during the day, many hillside view framing windows and wide openings to the terrace create a playful open-air atmosphere. In the kitchen, your inner chef will be inspired by the restaurant caliber appliances and gourmet working environment.

Outside, you’ll have over four-acres of olive groves and lawn to explore, a heated infinity pool, a bocce court, alfresco dining, fruit trees, and a small farm with chickens who will provide your group with fresh eggs. There’s also an outdoor grill and pizza oven to capture that authentic Old-World style of gourmet cooking. And, before dinner, make sure to select the perfect pairing from Vertine’s well-stocked wine cellar.

Just a short walk from home, Castello di Vertine’s ancient walls still serve as a home to villagers of Vertine. This medieval castle has been standing since at least the eleventh century, with little change to the exterior. If you’re up for a drive, Florence, Pisa, Siena, and so many more breath-taking Tuscan villages are located within an hour, or so, from home. And, of course, you’ll want to spend as much time as you can wandering the ancient streets, castles, and wineries of Gaiola, just a few minutes away in Chianti.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Nineteenth-century romance and modern luxury are in ample supply at the waterfront Villa Traversi. This historic vacation rental on the shores of Lake Como still has its traditional looks, but a recent makeover by its Italian fashion-designer owner has breathed new life into the interiors. More than 4,000 square feet of space, along with four bedrooms, offer room for a tranquil holiday with up to eight friends or family members.

Look out over the lake and breathe in the sweet fragrance of an olea fragrans plant from outdoor living areas with a hydro-massage pool, plunge pool, plenty of loungers and a barbecue. There’s even a fish pond with a softly splashing waterfall to offer all your senses a short honeymoon from the everyday. Inside, a pool table, satellite TV, Wi-Fi and DVD player ensure evenings of fun.

Past and present are perfectly balanced in the villa’s remodeled interiors. The open-concept living and dining room is anchored by a stately carved fireplace, while fold-away glass doors frame the views to the lake. The fully equipped kitchen is just as thoughtfully designed, with an inviting breakfast table in the center.

Villa Traversi has two bedrooms with private en-suite bathrooms: one with a double bed and one with two twin beds. The other two bedrooms have two twin beds each and share access to a hall bathroom. For parties wanting different accommodations, the twin beds may be converted to one double bed.

The villa’s setting in Laglio puts you within walking distance of a town center with shops, restaurants, services and more. Take the car on a day trip to historic attractions in Varenna or the Villa Monastero, or set off in a boat from the villa’s own dock to the town of Bellagio, just under an hour away on the lake.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Podere Panico is a place with a story, a history, and genuine character. It’s one of the few vacation rentals that you will actually spend hours exploring, examining the fine details, and imagining the life that this once abandoned farmhouse has seen. For over four-hundred years Podere Panico has sat atop a hill on one of the main pilgrimage roads to Rome. It has played host to countless families, French soldiers during the second world war, and many others that only Panico will ever know. With accommodations for sixteen, and acres of picturesque outdoor space , it’s perfect for a wedding or other large scale event.

Ancient wooden beams support Panico’s authentic clay roof. Romanesque brick archways connect living spaces within the interior. Designed, and eventually renovated, in the Medieval Tuscan architectural style, Panico is as close to the original build as possible. Generous living spaces merge seamlessly in its open concept layout. Vaulted ceilings and numerous openings keep the interior bright with natural light, and fresh hillside air flows freely throughout. Comfortable designer furniture and state of the art appliances add a touch of modern luxury to the rustic nature of this historical marvel.

Other modern updates include Wi-Fi, air conditioning, an exercise room and sauna, and a media room. Some more traditional features inside are the beautiful stone fireplace and wood oven, great for preparing authentic Tuscan meals. Outside, you’ll love the rolling hills, olive groves, and privacy of Panico’s property. There’s a swimming pool and hot tub as well.

All of Panico’s six bedrooms feature king sized beds and ensuite bathrooms. There are four bedrooms in the main house and two in the guest house. The master has its own fireplace and lounge area.

Nearby in Siena, a town famous for its art, cuisine, museums, and medieval cityscapes, you’ll find plenty to explore. The Piazza del Campo in Siena’s city centre is a great place to start. Inside its perimeter you will find town hall Palazzo Public and its tower Torre del Mangia. Make sure to bring a camera.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Explore the Sienese countryside from this secluded retreat overlooking the hills near San Gimignano. With a main house and 2 guest houses (each with its own kitchen and living areas), Villa Mugnello is perfect for families and large groups seeking expansive privacy near some of Tuscany's finest towns. Stroll the medieval streets of Radicondoli and return on foot to poolside relaxation and sunset feasts. 

Nestled on 2.2 hectares of private land with panoramic vistas, the villa sets the scene for peaceful escapes and special celebrations. Sip your morning espresso at the bistro tables by the swimming pool before dipping into the refreshing water. Kindle the barbecue and gather around the 20-person table to savor local delicacies from nearby markets. Open bottles of wine that you can only find in the hills stretching before you.

The renovated interiors balance original antique features—barrel-vaulted brick ceilings, exposed timber beams—with freshly modern décor. Plentiful natural light infuses the living and dining areas, where white walls showcase gallery-worthy artwork. Open the windows to the summer breeze or curl up by the fire on an autumn evening. Take a favorite book into a quiet den or gather in the main-house living room for a festive night.

The bedrooms balance rustic simplicity with beautiful touches of cheerful color and unique artwork. There are 8 queen bedrooms plus a kid-friendly twin bedroom in each Annex, both of which open to the garden. All of the bedrooms enjoy ensuite bathrooms, and several include private sitting areas. 

The center of Radicondoli is just 4 minutes away on foot, where you'll discover local cheeses at the caseificio (dairy), charming trattorias, and Renaissance splendors at Santi Simone e Giuda Church. Enjoy a daytrip to San Gimignano or Siena, or drive about 77 kilometers into Florence.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Perched high on the cliff of Positano, boasting unobstructed panoramic views of the city and its gulf, Giulia has been recently renovated with Mediterranean and stylish décor. With 6 en suite double bedrooms spread across three levels, this luxury property is ideal for families or group of friends.

The bright living areas have floor-to-ceiling windows that offer great views. A large patio terrace with coaches, chairs and dining table, is the ideal place for enjoying your meals or a sunset cocktail.

For fitness conscious travelers, the indoor heated pool and the fitness area is precious advantage.

This stylish villa features very modern and elegant décor, with a white and natural color palette reflecting the current interior design trends. The high-end quality of this property is reflected in every detail.
